result.execSummary:
The defendant Earl R. Soderman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant's bond of $500.00 has been applied towards the fine and costs.   The remaining balance of the fine and costs shall be paid from 22CV23 as stipulated by the parties.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections.  If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence may be served with huber.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence that the defendant is now serving.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earl R. Soderman

records.addlTxt: 2:55 PM Defendant Earl R. Soderman in court.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger in court for Earl R. Soderman.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea agreement put into the record.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Waive reading of Information.  Plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of  count 1.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Statement by Attorney Nussberger.  Court orders withheld sentence and placement on probation for two years with conditions of $500.00 fine plus costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA, counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; 90 days county jail concurrent to any sentencing now serving.  8 days of sentence credit.  Court orders in 22CV23 that $2,600.00 shall be forfeited and the balance of $2,304 will be first applied towards the fine and costs in 22CF20 and the balance shall be returned to the defendant.  - rt
Status hearing on June 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

01:20 PM Defendant Earl R. Soderman in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger by audio and video through Zoom.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 09:30 am. - rt

Initial Appearance set April 19, 2022 at 1:00 p.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Earl R. Soderman appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $500.00 cash bond and $4,000.00 signature bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No objection to bond by defendant.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
